1.text: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

2.text: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,

3.text: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

4.text: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

5.text: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

6.text: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

7.text: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

8.text: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

9.text: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

10.text: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

11.text: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

12.text: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
